chapter.verse: These words spake Jesus, and lifted up his eyes to heaven, and said, <woc>Father, the hour is come; glorify thy Son, that thy Son also may glorify thee:</woc>
<woc>As thou hast given him power over all flesh, that he should give eternal life to as many as thou hast given him.</woc>
<woc>And this is life eternal, that they might know thee the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom thou hast sent.</woc>
<woc>I have glorified thee on the earth: I have finished the work which thou gavest me to do.</woc>
<woc>And now, O Father, glorify thou me with thine own self with the glory which I had with thee before the world was.</woc>
<woc>I have manifested thy name unto the men which thou gavest me out of the world: thine they were, and thou gavest them me; and they have kept thy word.</woc>
<woc>Now they have known that all things whatsoever thou hast given me are of thee.</woc>
For I have given unto them the words which thou gavest me; and they have received them, and have known surely that I came out from thee, and they have believed that thou didst send me.
<woc>I pray for them: I pray not for the world, but for them which thou hast given me; for they are thine.</woc>
<woc>And all mine are thine, and thine are mine; and I am glorified in them.</woc>
And now I am no more in the world, but these are in the world, and I come to thee. Holy Father, keep through thine own name those whom thou hast given me, that they may be one, as we are.

<woc>While I was with them in the world, I kept them in thy name: those that thou gavest me I have kept, and none of them is lost, but the son of perdition; that the scripture might be fulfilled.</woc>
<woc>And now come I to thee; and these things I speak in the world, that they might have my joy fulfilled in themselves.</woc>
<woc>I have given them thy word; and the world hath hated them, because they are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.</woc>
<woc>I pray not that thou shouldest take them out of the world, but that thou shouldest keep them from the evil.</woc>
<woc>They are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.</woc>
<woc>Sanctify them through thy truth: thy word is truth.</woc>
<woc>As thou hast sent me into the world, even so have I also sent them into the world.</woc>
<woc>And for their sakes I sanctify myself, that they also might be sanctified through the truth.</woc>
<woc>Neither pray I for these alone, but for them also which shall believe on me through their word;</woc>
That they all may be one; as thou, Father, art in me, and I in thee, that they also may be one in us: that the world may believe that thou hast sent me.
<woc>And the glory which thou gavest me I have given them; that they may be one, even as we are one:</woc>
<woc>I in them, and thou in me, that they may be made perfect in one; and that the world may know that thou hast sent me, and hast loved them, as thou hast loved me.</woc>

<woc>Father, I will that they also, whom thou hast given me, be with me where I am; that they may behold my glory, which thou hast given me: for thou lovedst me before the foundation of the world.</woc>
<woc>O righteous Father, the world hath not known thee: but I have known thee, and these have known that thou hast sent me.</woc>
And I have declared unto them thy name, and will declare it: that the love wherewith thou hast loved me may be in them, and I in them.
